value.0: To counter the Crimson Prophet's evil machinations, Emperor Rakha has gathered from the four corners of the Sharakhan Empire a group of individuals capable of countering the Prophet's plans...

<StartAction>[A richly dressed noble lord of the Sharakhan Empire wobbles drunkenly towards the front of his escort caravan, the ox which has been pulling it having fallen to the ground, quite dead...]</Start>
Whatsh the meaning of thish? Whatsh happened here? Why... why that ox ish dead!

<StartAction>[The noble's wife, a richly dressed woman with pursed lips, seems quite livid over the delay.]</Start> Nalthan, what is the matter? We have to get little Thella home to get her rest! Do hurry, you drunken buffoon!
Yesh, yesh, yesh... <StartAction>[The nobleman turns to his guard.]</Start> Now, what ish the meaning of thish? What in Abaran could make an ox jusht fall over like that?!
<StartAction>[One of the escort guards turns swiftly towards the noble.]</Start> A nice dose of poison, that's what... Meant to ensure I have plenty of time to carry out my... duties...
What in the godsh namesh are you talking about man? Shpeak wordsh that make shome shense, will you?
<StartAction>[The guard sneers as he brings his halberd down upon the nobleman's head, sending him reeling to the ground...]</Start> Perhaps you'll understand this, fool!
Daddy!
For the glory of the Crimson Prophet, I take your life, Lord Nalthan Hy'lir! May your soul rot in the hells along with all who follow the path of Emperor Rakha!

<StartAction>[Suddenly, the diminutive Halfling driver of the caravan whirls around, whipping out a sharp short sword.]</Start> Well, well, well, looks like we got ourselves a traitor to the Empire in our midst...

<StartAction>[Before the treacherous servant of the Crimson Prophet can bring his killing blow upon Lord Nalthan, the Halfling plants his blade deeply into the soft spot of the guard's armor.]</Start>
Chosen by Rakha for his skill in subterfuge and infiltration, Tarin Lightfingers is a Halfling master of disguise, well versed in the ways of the Sharakhan Empire and the Northern Reaches...

Didn't even have ta' break a sweat on that one... <StartAction>[The Halfling's mouth breaks into a wiry grin, but it quickly fades as he notices another of the escort guards moving towards the wife and child of Lord Hy'lir...]</Start>
Markius! Behind ya'! Looks like we got ourselves more of the Prophet's cronies in our midst!
Stand back, you fools, or I'll slit the woman and the child's throats!

<StartAction>[Suddenly, a tall man standing next to Tarin Lightfingers draws for a dagger with unnerving quickness, and sends it flying through the air to land with a sick thud in the treacherous guard's throat.]</Start>
<StartAction>[The noblewoman, visibly shaken, turns her frightened eyes to her timely rescuer.]</Start> I... I... th... thank you, sir...
<StartAction>[The tall man nods his head.]</Start> Take your daughter to a place of safety, m'lady. My companions and I shall ensure your husband remains safe...
Yes... yes, of course... Come... come along, Thella... These... these good men will make sure Daddy's alright... Now... now come along, darling...

Markius Albright... a quiet, brooding fellow who serves as Rakha's agent equally well both in the wilderness and the darker alleys of the streets. He is a man of few words, his past a mystery even to those he calls friends...

Now, let's see what we can learn from this traitor, shall we? Perhaps he can tell us the Crimson Prophet's plans... <StartAction>[Markius turns towards the prone body of the treacherous guard.]</Start>

<StartAction>[Tarin turns his eyes up to Markius.]</Start> Don't think that's gonna' happen, chap... Looks like we already lost 'im... though I suppose Kara might be able to help us out with that particular problem...
<StartAction>[As if on cue, a sultry, dark haired Elven maiden, accompanied by a brutish Half-Orc, emerges from the shadowy corner nearby.]</Start> Did I hear mention of needing my aid?
Ah, there's our lovely lady now! Kara, perhaps you can... convince... our dead "friend" here to return long enough to give us some information, eh?
<StartAction>[A pained look crosses over the Elven woman's face, but she nods quietly.]</Start> I... I suppose I can... if it is so needed...
<StartAction>[Laying her hands upon the dead body of the treacherous guard, the Elven woman begins murmuring a soft, dark prayer.]</Start>
Akhana, Mother of Death, heed my call! Bring forth the soul of this treacherous worm, so that we may yet discover his foul purpose!

Kara Dy'nesh, daughter of the Wytch of Rhun, the High Matron of Akhana, Mistress of Death. The blood of the Dy'nesh family runs strong with the divine power of Akhana, but at a high cost, one which Kara fights daily against...
Mother of the Darkness, hear me! Let this soul pass back through your realm!
<StartAction>[Slowly, the spirit of the traitor rises from the ground, summoned from the afterlife by Kara's divine power...]</Start> Hisss.... Why have you summoned me from the grave, wench?!

<StartAction>[The large Half-Orc standing next to Kara, his eyes half-crazed, levels his massive axe towards the unnatural spirit from beyond.]</Start> You not speak to Kara that way, or me bash yer head in!

Brukus Bloodhammer, a savage, if a bit slow-witted, Half-Orc, known as much for his rapid changes in behavior as his brutal bloodlust in battle... He owes loyalty to none except his fellow companions.
<StartAction>[Kara places her hand gently on the Half-Orc's massive shoulder.]</Start> Be easy, Brukus. Your weapon would be of little use to us against such a being anyway...
<StartAction>[Brukus snarls for a moment, but seems to relent, letting his axe fall to his side.]</Start> If you say so...
Now, spirit, I command you to tell me what purpose led you to betray Rakha. Hear my bidding, and answer me truthfully!

<StartAction>[The spirit seethes angrily at the Elven woman, but seems powerless against her hold over it.]</Start> We were to kill the Hy'lir family for the glory of the Crimson Prophet! He is our true master, not the snake known as Rakha!
You may have stopped us here, but it matters not! Lord Hy'lir's death was to be only the beginning! The Crimson Prophet has plans to overthrow all the Northern Reaches!
Soon, all Abaran shall be consumed in the flames of the Crimson Prophet! All shall drown in the waves of blood that shall cover this land! You are powerless to stop it!

Oh, we shall see about that... <StartAction>[Apparently having grown tired of the spirit's ramblings, Kara waves her hand effortlessly, sending the spirit back to the depths of the Underworld...]</Start>
This is troublesome news... If the Crimson Prophet has managed to corrupt even members of the Imperial Guard, matters are far worse than we had expected... We must inform Markius at once.

<StartAction>[Striding proudly forward, a young man of knightly stature approaches the companions. Garbed in heavy armor and wielding the blade at his side with the ease of many years' practice, he appears a formidable opponent.]</Start>
Markius Albright, leader of Rakha's elite band. A noble, if stern, warrior, Markius serves his Emperor Rakha with utmost loyalty and purpose...

There is no need, Markius... I have already received a report from the Emperor that all across the Northern Reaches, the Prophet's agents have begun to move. It appears Sharakha may soon find itself at war...
But we may yet be able to foil the Prophet's plans, if we move quickly. Come. I have arranged for <FirstName> to ready the ship. We have work to be done.
These are Rakha's most secretive elite agents, His most trusted servants. And I am their newest addition...
The ship is ready, Markius. We may depart when you wish.
<StartAction>[Markius nods solemnly.]</Start> Good. Bring this Lord Hy'lir, and we will take him to a place of hiding, safe from his attackers. Come, my friends. We have little time to spare.

To the outside world, we are dead... No record remains to track our existence, our names are forgotten by our friends and family. We answer only to the call of Emperor Rakha himself, carrying out his will from the dark corners of the world.
We live to protect our Empire, to serve our Emperor Rakha... We are known only as the...
...ShadowGuard...

Our present times are not without strife and trouble. Within the Northern Reaches, the wild frontier along Sharakha's border, a terrible sorcerer of great power, known only as the Crimson Prophet, has begun leading a rebellion against our Emperor Rakha...
<StartAction>[From the darkness of the shadows, his presence felt if not seen, the man known only as the Crimson Prophet speaks to his faithful followers...]</Start>
Look upon the lands around you, Followers of the Crimson Path! Look at the sheep you have become!
Rakha, the "Great Savior," has made this land weak! Will you stand in Rakha's shadow, doing his bidding as mindless slaves?! Or shall you rise against the "Almighty One", take back what is yours!
We hear your words, Master! Too long have we followed Rakha blindly! No more! This land is ripe for the taking, and we go to reclaim what is ours!
Go forth, Servants of the Crimson Light! Go forth, and strike deeply into the heart of Rakha's realm!
The Crimson Prophet, spouting his words of betrayal and destruction, has turned many of our Empire's loyal men and women against the rule of Rakha...
Such was the birth of the Empire of Sharakha, a land dedicated to bringing peace and hope to our world once more...
All hail the glory of Emperor Rakha!
Let us give praise to the Great Savior!
Deliver us from the evils of this land, Almighty Rakha!
<StartAction>[Rakha raises his staff high in the air.]</Start> For too long have you lived in the shadow of tyranny! Too long has this world been consumed in darkness and fear!
Let your hearts be at ease, for from this day forth, we shall start a new order! One dedicated to peace and prosperity! We are the Empire of Sharakha, the Reborn Land!
Let us shed the dark days of the past, and bring the glory of Sharakha to all upon Abaran who live in fear!
Sharakha! Sharakha! All glory to the Empire!
For the glory of Sharakha and our savior Rakha! May He always guide us in wisdom and compassion!
Under Rakha's leadership, Sharakha has thrived, bringing the Great Savior's hope across all of Abaran.
Many hope that Rakha's reign will bring Abaran once more into a Golden Age, and under the rule of our glorious Emperor, it seems the Sharakhan Empire is poised to do just that...
In time, Rakha's fame grew. Rumor spread that the gods had heard the countless pleas of their mortal children, and sent a savior to rescue them from the darkness...
Those who had suffered for so long sang out praises in Rakha's name, while the tyrants of the land saw the Great Savior as a threat to their rule...
Glory be to Rakha! May He deliver us from our troubles and free us from the chains of tyranny!
Let your hearts be troubled no further... Hope has returned to you in your hour of darkness...
Out of my way! Begone curs! How dare you stand in the path of King Khagrim the Damned?!
Fools! All of them! <StartAction>[The crazed king turns his evil stare upon the sorcerer Rakha.]</Start> And you... you are behind all this trouble, aren't you...

<StartAction>[Rakha calmly faces the king, showing no fear before the tyrant's brutish might.]</Start> I simply seek to give them hope, for they have had so little. Can you not see the pain your people are in?
<StartAction>[The king snickers in derision.]</Start> All I see is an upstart fool... and one who shall not live to see the sunset! Men, rid me of this nuisance!

<StartAction>[As the guards close in upon Rakha, he lowers his head silently, calling upon his sorceries.]</Start> Too long have you troubled this land... No more shall the people of Abaran live in fear of your shadow!
<StartAction>[King Khagrim looks down in fear as huge boils begin appearing upon his skin.]</Start> Wh... What's this?! Wh... what have you done to me?! I... I...
So shall this land be cleansed of the taint of evil...
As Rakha overthrew the tyrants of the lands, the people praised him and followed his leadership. Soon, all of the southern lands of Abaran stood behind Rakha.
In the 1300th year after the fall of Ghaaris, a mysterious sorcerer arose from the wastelands of Arn, a humble man proclaiming himself Rakha, "The Great Savior."
<StartAction>[An old man kneels gingerly beside his dying wife, stricken with disease and hunger, her eyes glassed over in pain.]</Start> Oh, my poor dear... I... If only there was more I could do...

<StartAction>[The woman looks weakly towards her husband.]</Start> Do not worry... 'Tis my time to go, 'tis all... Per... perhaps its better... better to leave now... before... before it grows any worse...
<StartAction>[The elderly man clasps his wife's hand tightly, tears streaming down his face.]</Start> No... no... don't leave me yet...

<StartAction>[A tall man, his skin horribly burned and his face covered in a strange mask, slowly approaches. Though he appears to have suffered severe wounds to his body, his eyes shine with kindness behind his mask..]</Start>

Disease... death... I sense it near... It... it clouds this woman's soul... but perhaps I may bring an easing to her pain... <StartAction>[The man kneels gently down beside the pain stricken woman, laying his hands upon her...]</Start>
You... you don't go bothering my wife now! She... she's in enough pain, and doesn't need any...
<StartAction>[The man's words catch in his throat as the sores upon the woman's skin begin to slowly heal, her eyes coming into focus...]</Start> Wh... what's this? I... I'm healed!
<StartAction>[The stranger pats her gingerly on the shoulder.]</Start> Be at ease. Let the darkness of your pain trouble you no further...
Oh... oh, my love... you're... you're alive! I... I don't know how to thank you, sir!
There is no need for thanks... That your wife shall live another day is reward enough. Go now, and tell all you see that hope has returned to these lands once more... Rakha has returned to you...
I... I... yes, of course! Th... thank you! Oh, thank you!
Rakha continued through the war torn lands of Abaran, preaching words of peace and hope. Many hearkened to his words, seeking an end to the long age of destruction and death...
Abaran, an ancient world, even by the reckoning of the gods. Abaran, a land of all manner of strange and wondrous beings. Abaran, whose history is as vast and varied as the races who inhabit it...
In the Ancient Tongue, Abaran means "Jewel of the Gods," legend claiming its creation having come before all other worlds, a beautiful gem for the gods to look upon with wonder...
Perhaps such was once true... but Abaran has fallen upon dark times in past centuries, and many believe the gods have forsaken us upon this troubled world.

Historians claim that during the ancient days Abaran stood unified under the benevolent reign of the realm of Ghaaris, a magnificent Golden Realm of peace and prosperity. But as with all things, even Ghaaris saw its end, meeting some unknown demise.

Abaran was plunged into a long age of darkness, the ancient wonders lost and forgotten with the onslaught of war. Those who ruled did so with an iron fist, crushing all who would dare to oppose them...
Well, well, well... What do we have here, boys? Seems this old man and his woman aren't content with the rule of King Khagrim...
You... you monster! You... you've taken all that we own! Our... our daughters, our food! Trouble us no more, and allow us what few years we have left in peace!

Fool! I am King Khagrim, and none shall speak to me in such a manner! Guards! Throw these two in the dungeons! Let them rot among the rats, and show the rabble of this land what comes of disobeying my rule!
<StartAction>[The guard smirks evilly.]</Start> With pleasure, my lord...
Wh... what?! No! NO! You can't do this to us!
Take them! I grow tired of hearing this incessant prattle!
All lived in fear, and few saw an end to the tyranny which had overtaken our lands...
<StartAction>[Instructor Jarvis gave you this book as a graduation present and it appears to be written in his own hand. The tome is heavy and the Table of Contents ornately decorated.]</Start>
